+
'''MDX file''' - Media Data eXtended. MDX format is a single [[binary file|binary image file]] of a CD, DVD, HD-DVD or BD-DVD disc. MDX file includes the [[Magic_number_(programming)|magic number]] "MEDIA DESCRIPTOR" appearing in the beginning of the file and all data from the disc. This format is very similar to MDS/MDF format and supports almost all of MDS/MDF format features except that all data is in one monolithic file only.
â

  â
'''Daemon Tools''' (styled '''DAEMON Tools''' by its creators) is a [[disk image emulator]] and [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]]. Daemon Tools was originally a furtherance in the development of another program, ''Generic SafeDisc emulator'', and incorporated all of its features. The program claims to be able to defeat most [[copy protection]] schemes such as [[SafeDisc]] and [[SecuROM]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/gamedb.php?letter=all|title=Supported games and protections database}}</ref> It is currently compatible with Windows XP, Windows Vista and Windows 7.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/news/bbe0f423e15c028735eadcce333289e6 |title=DAEMON Tools Lite 4.35.5 represents full Windows 7 support |date=23 October 2009 |accessdate=3 November 2009}}</ref>
  â   â
==Editions==
  â
Versions prior to v4.00 had only one edition. That edition was [[freeware]], had no [[adware]], and was solely an imaging disc-emulation software (no image conversion, creation, burning, and so forth), [http://www.disc-tools.com/download/daemon347+hashcalc] is the last such version. Every version since v4.00 contains bundled adware concealed as a toolbar.
  â   â
Since version 4.00, three editions of the product exist: '''[http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/products/dtLite Lite]''', '''[http://www.daemon-tools.cc/products/dtproStd Pro Standard]''' and '''[http://www.daemon-tools.cc/products/dtproAdv Pro Advanced]'''. A feature comparison is given below:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.daemon-tools.cc/products/compare|title=DAEMON-Tools.cc :: Products :: Compare}}</ref>
  â   â

==Y.A.S.U.==

'''Y.A.S.U''' ('''Yet Another SecuROM Utility''') is a very small tool that works as a "SCSI-drive protector". It was created by sYk0, who also created [[CureROM]] (but CureROM uses an alternative method to protect SCSI drives).
  â   â
Itâs a simple utility that can be used to hide emulated drives from [[SecuROM|SecuROM 7]] and [[SafeDisc|SafeDisc 4]]. YASU is a companion program for Daemon Tools and currently being hosted, supported and maintained by the Daemon Tools team. On March 4 of 2009, sYk0 announced development of '''Omen''' which is to succeed development of YASU.<ref>http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f40/omen-future-anti-blacklists-near-23216/</ref> As of January 2010, development of Omen has been abandoned.<ref>http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f40/omen-future-anti-blacklists-near-23216/index4.html#post123255</ref>
  â   â

==External links==
+
MDX file contains [[metadata]] about the original media, specifically the position of the [[layer break|layer breaks]], sessions, tracks and different other physical parameters of disc. An MDX file is then used to emulate original CD/DVD disc with optical drive emulation software. It is called an ''MDX file'' because of its implemented file extension ''.mdx''. It could also be described as being an archive file containing all data from a CD/DVD disc.

== Support ==
â
{{Disk image emulators software}}
+
MDX file can be created by [[optical disc]] imaging applications. The MDX file format is utilized by the commercial optical drive emulation software DAEMON Tools Pro versions and Astroburn Pro CD/DVD burning application. Currently this CD/DVD image format is supported only in [[DAEMON Tools]] and Astroburn software.
â
